TopicTitle: What do you do while ksp is loading?

Articles.Content:
With a 10 to 15 minute load time for me, I was wondering what you guys did while it's loading

Edited April 29, 2017 by munlander1
Pick up whatever book I happen to be reading and read some.
Read some, make a cup of Earl Grey, or sometimes, grab a snack.
Stare at the screen. Would surf a bit in the fourms if I had to.

Depends on my situation. Sometimes I'm winding down some other project, and I let KSP load in the background. More often than not, I just watch the loading bar for anomalies. Usually there are none, but every now and then I notice an unexpected part or a particularly amusing loading hint. This practice has become significantly less interesting, now that there's that near-silent asset bundle phase, but my interest in modding has increased, so it more or less balances out. Load times are much faster now than the six-minute wait back when I was stuffing 0.20.2 to bursting with mods. Immediately after each update, the load times seem blazingly fast, but that's probably more to do with my sudden lack of mods than any actual decrease.
Usually, look at whatever other thing I have on my web browser. Usually YouTube or forums.
15 minutes? Really? Wow. Mine takes about a minute, but only ~550 patches right now.

15 minutes ago, tater said:

15 minutes? Really? 

I do have some mods though.

I know most of you guys are loading a bunch of mods, but I'm really surprised at the times mentioned. I'm only running a few mods myself, with 97 patches. It's a full 20 seconds before the 'Squad' logo shows at startup... 2:01.35 minutes to the main menu.

1 hour ago, LordFerret said:

I know most of you guys are loading a bunch of mods, but I'm really surprised at the times mentioned. I'm only running a few mods myself, with 97 patches. It's a full 20 seconds before the 'Squad' logo shows at startup... 2:01.35 minutes to the main menu.

Now I'm curious about your specs. I haven't measured my load times, and not to boast, I have 50 mods and 100 times as many patches as you do, and it loads in about the same time (I think). I'm also running on a 2-year old computer.

I've gotta measure my load time later. 2:22.06 with 50 mods and 8403 patches.

Edited April 30, 2017 by TotallyNotHuman_
Measured my load time, yo!
I usually just get on my phone (it's right next to the computer usually), and check on some of my favorite blogs and stuff.
I have a pile of speedcubes on my desk...

Sometimes I read. Other times I do a bit of calculations. Most of the time I stare into the cold dark emptiness of subatomic space like a hypnotized chicken looking deep into the depth of your soul...

Okay, not THAT much, but...you get the gist. Why say "do nothing" when you can elaborate the quack out of it?
Loading takes <2 minutes here, during which I alt-tab and check out the forum. I'd make coffee, but it takes too long.
Loading for me is fairly quick. I usually just think about what my plan is, or why KSP keeps crashing...

I still read the funny loading comments.

@Bill Phil are you stationed at Peterson AFB or just like the insignia?
Sleep, with an earphone. As soon as KSP menu music starts, I'm awake
Most at the time just wait for the game to be loaded at my seat, because it only takes like 60 seconds. But sometimes i take a ride in the toilet, or maybe i forget KSP and find out 20 minutes later.

Not much... It takes (including the Steam thing that precedes everything):

0:18 to Squad monkey
1:15 to main menu
1:33 to Space Center
Enjoying KSP running at its peak performance

On 29/04/2017 at 8:04 PM, munlander1 said:

With a 10 to 15 minute load time for me, I was wondering what you guys did while it's loading

It might be time to upgrade to a pc with an NVMe drive.
It depends on what I'll be doing in the game. I might be on the forums or I could be looking on Google Images for designs.
Reading some new posts in this forum, as now. KSP is starting at this moment and here I am

41 minutes ago, Camacha said:

It might be time to upgrade to a pc with an NVMe drive.

Using a crappy laptop, no dedicated graphics card. 4gb's of ram too. Been crashing on world of tanks because if thermal control problems. I will soon be ditching this laptop.

Edited April 30, 2017 by munlander1

10 minutes ago, munlander1 said:

4gb's of ram too.

Half a GB of ram is fairly poor. Does KSP even boot on that?
